clinical_study.brief_title: Study Of Anti-IGF-IR CP-751,871 In Patients With Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1, Open Label, Multiple Dose Escalation Study To Evaluate The Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics And Pharmacodynamics Of CP 751,871 In Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase 1 study of anti-IGF-IR CP-751,871 in patients with solid tumors currently enrolling patients 9 years old and older with Ewing's sarcoma family of tumors (Ewing's, PNET and Askin's).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 150 days after the last administration of study drug
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent are events between first dose of study drug and up to 150 days after last dose that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pretreatment state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) in Cycle 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) in Cycle 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 4: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) in Cycle 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) in Cycle 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 4: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Decay Half-Life (t1/2) in Cycle 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Decay Half-Life (t1/2) in Cycle 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 4: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Last Quantifiable Concentration (Tlast) in Cycle 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Last Quantifiable Concentration (Tlast) in Cycle 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 4: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Systemic Clearance (CL) in Cycle 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose
secondary_outcome.description: CL is a quantitative measure of the rate at which a drug substance is removed from the body.

secondary_outcome.measure: Systemic Clearance (CL) in Cycle 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 4: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose
secondary_outcome.description: CL is a quantitative measure of the rate at which a drug substance is removed from the body.

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration at End of Infusion (Cendinf) in Cycle 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration at End of Infusion (Cendinf) in Cycle 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 4: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of Distribution (Vz) in Cycle 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Vz is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired blood concentration of a drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of Distribution (Vz) in Cycle 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 4: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Vz is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired blood concentration of a drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss) in Cycle 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Vz is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired blood concentration of a drug. Vss is the Vz at steady-state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss) in Cycle 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 4: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Vz is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired blood concentration of a drug. Vss is the Vz at steady-state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) in Cycle 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) in Cycle 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 4: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Extrapolated Infinite Time [AUC (0 - ∞)] in Cycle 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero (pre-dose) to extrapolated infinite time (0 - ∞).

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Profile From Time 0 to 504 Hours (21 Days) (AUC504) in Cycle 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Profile From Time 0 to 504 Hours (21 Days) (AUC504) in Cycle 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 4: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Profile From Time 0 to 672 Hours (28 Days) (AUC672) in Cycle 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Profile From Time 0 to 672 Hours (28 Days) (AUC672) in Cycle 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 4: 0 (predose), 1, 24 and 72 hours, 7 and 14 days postdose

secondary_outcome.measure: Human Anti-human Antibodies (HAHA) Levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes predose in Cycles 1 up to 61, and last scheduled follow-up visit (up to 150 days from the last dose of study drug)
secondary_outcome.description: HAHA were indicators of immunogenicity to figitumumab.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Circulating Tumor Cells (CTCs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes predose in all cycles (up to 17); 1, 3, 7, and 14 days postdose in Cycle 1 for dose escalation and RP2D extension cohorts; and also 1 day postdose in Cycle 4 for RP2D extension cohort
secondary_outcome.description: Quantification of CTCs using an automated microscope system

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Insulin-like Growth Factor 1 Receptor (IGF-1R) Positive CTCs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes predose in all cycles (up to 17); 1, 3, 7, and 14 days postdose in Cycle 1 for dose escalation and RP2D extension cohorts; and also 1 day postdose in Cycle 4 for RP2D extension cohort
secondary_outcome.description: Quantification of IGF-IR positive CTCs using an automated microscope system

intervention.description: Currently dosing at 20 mg/kg, IV on day 1 of each 28 day cycle until progression or unacceptable toxicity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of Ewing's sarcoma family tumors
Exclusion Criteria:
- Concurrent treatment with any other anti tumor agents

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Figitumumab 3 mg/kg
group.description: Figitumumab 3 milligram/kilogram (mg/kg) was supplied as a liquid solution administered as an intravenous (IV) infusion over 2.5 hours (plus or minus 15 minutes) on Day 1 of each cycle (3 weeks in duration) for dose escalation cohort.

group.title: Figitumumab 6 mg/kg
group.description: Figitumumab 6 mg/kg was supplied as a liquid solution administered as an IV infusion over 2.5 hours (plus or minus 15 minutes) on Day 1 of each cycle (3 weeks in duration) for dose escalation cohort.

group.title: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg RP2D
group.description: Figitumumab 20 mg/kg was supplied as a liquid solution administered as an IV infusion over 2.5 hours (plus or minus 15 minutes) on Day 1 of each cycle (3 weeks in duration) for recommended Phase 2 dose [RP2D] extension cohort.

outcome.title: Human Anti-human Antibodies (HAHA) Levels
outcome.description: HAHA were indicators of immunogenicity to figitumumab.
outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes predose in Cycles 1 up to 61, and last scheduled follow-up visit (up to 150 days from the last dose of study drug)
outcome.population: Per protocol, the presence of HAHA would only be evaluated for those samples with plasma figitumumab concentrations below the limit of quantification (BLQ). Since none of the postdose samples in the study had figitumumab concentrations BLQ, therefore no sample was analyzed for HAHA.

group.title: Figitumumab 3, 6, 10, 20 mg/kg

outcome.title: Number of Circulating Tumor Cells (CTCs)
outcome.description: Quantification of CTCs using an automated microscope system
outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes predose in all cycles (up to 17); 1, 3, 7, and 14 days postdose in Cycle 1 for dose escalation and RP2D extension cohorts; and also 1 day postdose in Cycle 4 for RP2D extension cohort
outcome.population: Pretreatment CTCs were detected in an insufficient number of participants to analyze for any treatment effect on this pharmacodynamic biomarker.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an adverse event (AE) and a serious AE (SAE). However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The study was completed and 2 participants in figitumumab 20 mg/kg RP2D ESFT group were transitioned to compassionate figitumumab treatment as investigators judged they were receiving benefit from the protocol therapy.
